intro: Hieracium straforelloanum, commonly known as the Straforello hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm, featuring basal and alternate leaves that are usually hairy and lanceolate in shape. Its flowers are yellow, arranged in a single head, and bloom from late spring to early autumn. Hieracium straforelloanum is often found in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in sunny, well-drained habitats.
